enWisdom: Piety restrains one from committing acts that are forbidden

Wisdom: اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ جِهَةَ مَا خَلَقَكُمْ لَهُ
enWisdom: Be wary of your duty towards Allah with regards to that which He has created you for

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ مِنِ اكْتِسَابِ الْحَسَنَاتِ اجْتِنَابُ السَّيِّئَاتِ
enWisdom: Keeping away from evil deeds is better than earning [reward through] good deeds

Wisdom: أَصْلُ الْوَرَعِ تَجَنُّبُ الْآثَامِ وَالتَّنَزُّهُ عَنِ الْحَرَامِ
enWisdom: The root of piety is keeping away from sins and refraining from the forbidden
When you [wish to] guard yourself, then be wary of the things that Allah has forbidden

Wisdom: رَحِمَ اللَّهُ امْرَءاً تَوَرَّعَ عَنِ الْمَحَارِمِ وَتَحَمَّلَ الْمَغَارِمَ وَنَافَسَ فِي مُبَادَرَةِ جَزِيلِ الْمَغَانِمِ
enWisdom: May Allah have mercy upon the person who refrains from the forbidden, bears the liabilities [of others] and vies in hastening towards the abundant prizes [of the Hereafter]
One who is truly pious keeps away from the forbidden actions
One whose piety increases, his sins decrease

Wisdom: مِنْ لَوَازِمِ الْوَرَعِ التَّنَزُّهُ عَنِ الْآثَامِ
enWisdom: One of the prerequisites of piety is refraining from sins
Eschewing forbidden actions is from the most excellent piety
The basis of piety is refraining from the forbidden [actions]
Paradise is attained through abstaining from sins
There is no piety like eschewing sins
There is no God-wariness like desisting from the forbidden

Wisdom: لَا وَرَعَ أَنْفَعُ مِنْ تَجَنُّبِ الْمَحَارِمِ
enWisdom: There is no piety more beneficial than eschewing the forbidden

Wisdom: لَا وَرَعَ أَنْفَعُ مِنْ تَرْكِ الْمَحَارِمِ وَتَجَنُّبِ الْمَآثِمِ
enWisdom: There is no piety more beneficial than abandoning the forbidden and eschewing sins
